all.title: Ellen G. White in Europe 1885-1887
all.author: D. A. Delafield
all.description: Between the summers of 1971 and 1972, Pastor Dores A. Delafield and his wife, Evelyn, conducted seminar-type meetings with ministers, teachers, and laymen throughout Western and Eastern Europe. Often their journeys took them to towns and cities where Ellen White lived and labored between the years 1885 and 1887. Ellen G. White in Europe is the first serious attempt ever to put into print the record of those eventful years when Mrs. White labored so tirelessly on the European continent. Her influence was felt in the evangelistic and institutional expansion of Seventh-day Adventist witnessing in eight European countries. As a preacher and counselor she participated in important conference sessions. She lectured in the major Adventist churches in Europe, meanwhile carrying forward a vast literary work, the influence of which is still felt around the world. Mrs. White appears in this volume not simply as a Christian laborer on the European scene, but as the Lord's special messenger, a warm, friendly human being yet conscientious and faithful in bearing her strong and inspired testimony for the Lord. The book opens an entirely new chapter in her lifework little known to the world and to the vast majority of Seventh-day Adventists. Her diary accounts of her European travels have been drawn from heavily as source material.
all.publisher: Washington, D.C.: Review and Herald Publishing Association

all.title: Ellen G. White: The Early Years: 1827-1862 (vol. 1)
all.author: Arthur Lacey White
all.description: This volume traces Ellen Whites activities through her developing Christian experience, the Advent movement and disappointment of 1844, and how she became the recipient of visions. It deals with her place with her husband and Joseph Bates in laying the foundations of the Seventh-day Adventist Church, and discloses the vital role the visions had in this development.
all.publisher: Hagerstown, MD: Review and Herald Publishing Association

all.title: Ellen G. White: The Progressive Years: 1862-1876 (vol. 2)
all.author: Arthur Lacey White
all.description: Volume two of the Ellen G. White biography traces the development of James and Ellen White's leadership roles in the infant Adventist church. By 1875, their roles were well-defined-James as apostle and organizer; Ellen as messenger of the Lord. During these years of growth, Adventists established sanitariums, schools, camp meetings, and sent their first missionary overseas.
all.publisher: Hagerstown, MD: Review and Herald Publishing Association

all.title: Ellen G. White: The Lonely Years: 1876-1891 (vol. 3)
all.author: Arthur Lacey White
all.description: Volume three picks up the Ellen White story at a high point in her ministry–a time when she was writing on the life of Christ and also engaged, with her husband, James, president of the General Conference, in a grueling camp meeting labor that had become a recurring summertime activity. The last years of James White’s life were marked by notable achievements in building the church and its institutions in spite of periods impaired by illness. His rather sudden death at the age of 60 shocked both Ellen White and the church.
all.publisher: Hagerstown, MD: Review and Herald Publishing Association

all.title: Ellen G. White: The Australian Years: 1891-1900 (vol. 4)
all.author: Arthur Lacey White
all.description: The nine years Ellen White spent in Australia introduced her to new and different living and working conditions. It also placed upon her responsibilities in some areas she had not previously borne. She helped begin the work in that continent and continued to write letters of counsel to the leaders of the church in America.
all.publisher: Hagerstown, MD: Review and Herald Publishing Association

all.title: Ellen G. White: The Early Elmshaven Years: 1900-1905 (vol. 5)
all.author: Arthur Lacey White
all.description: Volume five of the Ellen G. White biography explores Mrs. White’s deep involvement in the events and changes that took place in the Seventh-day Adventist Church during this period: the 1901 and 1903 General Conference Sessions, the Battle Creek Sanitarium fire, the Review and Herald fire, the threat of pantheism, and the establishment of sanitariums in California.
all.publisher: Hagerstown, MD: Review and Herald Publishing Association

all.title: Ellen G. White: The Later Elmshaven Years: 1905-1915 (vol. 6)
all.author: Arthur Lacey White
all.description: This last volume in the six-volume biography of Ellen White is devoted to the last decade of the fruitful life of this messenger of the Lord. It covers the establishment of the Loma Linda Sanitarium, the San Francisco earthquake, and the establishment of Pacific Union College. During this time she also published the 1911 edition of The Great Controversy, and during the next few years produced several other books.
all.publisher: Hagerstown, MD: Review and Herald Publishing Association

all.title: Ellen White: Woman of Vision
all.author: Arthur Lacey White
all.description: An beautiful abridgement of the 6-volume biography on the life of Ellen G. White, written by her grandson, Arthur Lacey White.

all.title: Life Sketches Manuscript
all.author: Ellen Gould White
all.description: Includes annotations on the original Life Sketches manuscript. A book published in 1915 on the life and ministry of Ellen G. White.

all.title: A Call to Stand Apart
all.author: Ellen Gould White
all.description: Designed to meet the needs of twenty-first-century young adults, this compilation handles life topics from prayer and communion with God to how to live a pure Christian life in today's world. In order to reach a larger audience of youth, the original texts have been condensed and modernized, every effort being taken to faithfully retain the message.

all.title: Beginning of the End
all.author: Ellen Gould White
all.description: Focusing on the time from creation until the last days of King David, this modern English version of Patriarchs and Prophets delves into the origins of the great controversy between God and Satan, chronicles the battle as it transferred to Earth, and illustrates how God's faithful people have fought the good fight of faith through the ages. As the first of a five-part series, The Beginning of the End describes the historical foundation for what we see in our world today and gives principles on how to take a stand for truth even in our day. And in it all, we see that “God is Love.”

all.title: Humble Hero
all.author: Ellen Gould White
all.description: The life of Jesus, His methods of teaching and working, His great sacrifice and love for fallen humanity. These are the themes which all of heaven delights to contemplate, and which bring the greatest joy to God's children. In lively language, and with deep lessons for our lives today, Humble Hero (a version of The Desire of Ages, revised into modern English) brings the reader face to face with their Saviour— the Lord of heaven, who became one of us for our redemption.

all.title: Love Under Fire
all.author: Ellen Gould White
all.description: Love Under Fire outlines the grand sweep of events that have brought us to this point and will usher in this world's final events. Throughout the history of this earth, Satan has misrepresented God's character of love. He has put “love under fire” Today, more than ever before in earth's history, we are engaged in this battle between good and evil.

all.title: Royalty and Ruin
all.author: Ellen Gould White
all.description: As part of the Conflict of the Ages series, Prophets and Kings stands out in its narration of both the ups and downs of God's people. From Israel's greatness under Solomon's reign, to her downfall during the Babylonian captivity, and the subsequent history up to the time of Christ, God always had His faithful few who stood for truth in every circumstance. Royalty and Ruin tells these fascinating experiences in modern English, and details the lives of so many godly men and women who have gone before us.

all.title: Story of Hope
all.author: Ellen Gould White
all.description: Drawing from both Biblical accounts and Ellen G. White's unique and inciteful visions, the Story of Hope offers a glimpse behind history’s curtain where we learn of God's plan of redemption for man even before his creation. The book unfolds the origin of evil, while revealing both God's patience in dealing with its results throughout history and His plan for resolving it completely in the very near future.

all.title: Steps to Jesus
all.author: Ellen Gould White
all.description: True conversion begins by beholding love— God's love for us, so beautifully illustrated in the life of our Saviour, Jesus. And as we take the following steps on the road to a new life, faith in His love is what will carry us. This modern English version of Steps to Christ details the practical steps in our walk with the Lord, in order to solidify our experience and prepare us to meet our Redeemer face to face.

all.title: The Great Hope (Adapted)
all.author: Ellen Gould White
all.description: As you go through life, you may sense that the world is gripped in a conflict between good and evil. From what you see in the news it may look as if evil is winning. Headlines describe famine, wars, unemployment, pollution, and disease. The media can tell you what is happening, but this book reveals why. The Great Hope also tells you what will happen next. This glimpse into the future is based on a source that has never failed in its prophecies—the Bible. The conflict between good and evil is coming to a dramatic climax that will affect every family on the planet. But take hope. You can choose to be on the winning side.
all.publisher: Review and Herald Publishing Association, Hagerstown, MD

all.title: The Ministry of Health and Healing
all.author: Ellen Gould White
all.description: This modern English version of The Ministry of Healing focuses on the health work— first exemplified by Christ, and carried forward by His people. From diet and temperance, to prayer and psychology, this book touches on every aspect of a life of health. And, as Christ was the original Doctor, so we are to give an influence of life and health in our work today.

all.title: True Education
all.author: Ellen Gould White
all.description: Since its original publication in 1903, Education has been a faithful standard-bearer for parents and educators on the topic of child education and home life. In this modern English version, the same truths are re-published for today's generation. From the importance and history of education in Bible times, to the methods of reaching the hearts of children in our day, this publication's aim is to prepare children for their life-work on Earth and their great work in the heavenly courts.

all.title: Unlikely Leaders
all.author: Ellen Gould White
all.description: In the power of the Early Rain, the first apostles took the gospel to all ends of the known world. But they were not met without resistance. In this new version of The Acts of the Apostles (revised into modern English), the reader travels with the early believers as they preached the message of Christ in their home country and in heathen lands, experiencing terrible defeat and wonderful triumph. Their experience is a foretaste of our work under the power of the Holy Spirit in our day.

all.title: Noah Webster’s 1828 Dictionary
all.author: Noah Webster
all.description: Noah Webster's 1828 American Dictionary of the English Language was produced during the years when the American home, church and school were established upon a Biblical and patriotic basis. Webster made important contributions to an American educational system which kept the nation on a Christian Constitutional course for many years.

all.title: The Pocket Ellen G. White Dictionary
all.author: Jud Lake & Michael W. Campbell
all.description: The Ellen G. White Pocket Sized Dictionary is a resource of definitions and explanations for hundreds of Ellen White's words and phrases that may not be understood in our 21st century culture.

all.title: Angel Over Her Tent
all.author: D. A. Delafield
all.description: Angel Over Her Tent presents Mrs. White as a person all youth would enjoy knowing. We share the loneliness of her separation from her boys during her trips in the service of the church, her concern for people in desperate need of food and help, her quiet sense of humor, her enjoyment of Sabbath afternoon picnics. The reader watches as she struggles with danger and visits faraway places. This book will give every young person a new insight into Mrs. White’s life.

all.title: Campfire Junior Stories from the days of S.D.A. Pioneers
all.author: Arthur Lacey White
all.description: God’s providences in the history of our church can well form a very valuable part of the story presentations made to our boys and girls and our young men and young women. Emphasis was given to this in the 1961 North American Leadership Training Camp conducted at Lone Star Camp, Athens, Texas

all.title: His Messenger
all.author: Ruth Wheeler
all.description: The stories in this volume are all true and are taken from Mrs. White’s books, letters, and articles printed in various periodicals. Not only are the stories true, but in many cases we have used the very words that Mrs. White used in speaking and writing.

all.title: “I'd Like To Ask Sister White ...”
all.author: Ellen Gould White
all.description: This book answers common questions you may have about Sister White. They will be answered in her own words, taken from her diaries, letters, articles, and books.

all.title: Over My Shoulder
all.author: Ella May White Robinson
all.description: When Ella White Robinson was well along in years, she finally had time to look back over her shoulder, and describe for us the panorama of her life from the perspective of being the grand-daughter of Ellen White.

all.title: Sister White
all.author: Arthur Whitefield Spalding
all.description: A collection of interesting childrens stories about the life of Ellen G. White

all.title: Stories of My Grandmother
all.author: Ella May White Robinson
all.description: True stories from accounts of the visions of Ellen G. White that were verified by hundreds of reliable witnesses, some of whom have left written reports of the events and circumstances accompanying them. Detail and conversation are based on Mrs. White’s personal correspondence and diary records, upon her own stories and those of her son, William Clarence White, who was my father, and upon information gleaned from her relatives and friends. Some stories are based upon my own 33 year intimate acquaintance with my grandmother--Ellen White.

all.title: There Shines A Light
all.author: Arthur Whitefield Spalding
all.description: A collection of stories for children drawn from the life of Ellen G. White

all.title: A Gift of Light
all.author: Roger W. Coon
all.description: It is impossible to tell the story of the beginning and subsequent development of the Seventh-day Adventist church without telling the story of one of its cofounders, Ellen G. White. While she herself preferred the designation “special messenger,” it is significant that she never contradicted anyone who happened to refer to her as a prophet.

all.title: A Prophet Among You
all.author: T. Housel Jemison
all.description: This book has been prepared primarily for use in college classes in the Gift of Prophecy, it should be useful to Seventh-day Adventist ministers and others who wish to make a careful study of the place of the prophetic gift in the Seventh-day Adventist church today.

all.title: Believe His Prophets
all.author: Denton Edward Rebok
all.description: A revision and expansion of the studies and themes by the author of "Divine Guidance, Denton E. Rebok."

all.title: Divine Guidance in the Remnant of God’s Church
all.author: Denton Edward Rebok
all.description: The identifying marks of the “remnant of God’s church” are obedience to the commandments of God, and the presence of the testimony of Jesus Christ, which is the Spirit of prophecy. We are members of the remnant of God’s church only when we are found obeying His commandments and having or possessing or clinging to the Spirit of prophecy.

all.title: Ellen G. White and Her Critics
all.author: Francis D. Nichol
all.description: A collection of factual evidence regarding the life and work of Mrs. Ellen G. White for answering charges made by her critics.

all.title: Ellen G. White — Messenger to the Remnant
all.author: Arthur Lacey White
all.description: A series of articles about the work of the White Estate trustees after the death of Ellen White in 1915. Four additional articles explain the various phases of Mrs. White’s life, work, and ministry.

all.title: Messenger of the Lord
all.author: Herbert E. Douglass
all.description: A comprehensive study of Ellen White's life and her gift of prophecy will give you a complete look at her ministry and the time in which she worked.

all.title: The Abiding Gift of Prophecy
all.author: Arthur Grosvenor Daniells
all.description: The prophetic gift has been God’s chosen method of revealing Himself to the human race after man had been ruined through sin. This prophetic gift was to abide with the church from Adam to the second advent of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ, when He comes to take His redeemed people to Paradise. It did not cease with the apostles, but is traceable through the centuries until the final days of earths history.

all.title: The Ellen G. White Writings
all.author: Arthur Lacey White
all.description: Arthur White, was for many years secretary of the Ellen G. White Estate. He was also the grandson of Ellen White. This book exists to pass onto the readers his intimate knowledge of the operation of inspiration and the writing of the prophetic message as seen in the experience of Ellen G. White.

all.title: The Great Visions of Ellen G. White
all.author: Roger W. Coon
all.description: A selection of 10 of Ellen White’s most significant visions and examines them in the greater light of their immediate historical context.

all.title: The Spirit of Prophecy in the Advent Movement
all.author: William Ambrose Spicer
all.description: A look back at the many experiences and tokens of God's special care and guidence over the work of Seventh-day Adventist movement through the gift of the Spirit of Prophecy and His messenger--Ellen G. White.

all.title: The Testimony of Jesus
all.author: Francis McLellan Wilcox
all.description: F.M. Wilcox defense of the Spirit of Prophecy

all.title: The Voice of The Spirit
all.author: Juan Carlos Viera
all.description: A study on how God Has Led His People Through the Gift of Prophecy

all.title: The World of Ellen G. White
all.author: Gary Land
all.description: This volume of short, descriptive essays attempts to provide the essential historical background for understanding Ellen White’s writings. The authors have chosen to explore selected elements of American nineteenth century history that were either of significance to this shaper of Adventism or place her concerns within the context of the larger society. Thus the writers respectively address such subjects as eating and drinking habits, travel conditions, and entertainment, among other things in society.

all.title: What Ellen White has Meant to Me
all.author: Herbert E. Douglass
all.description: In these short essays Adventist pioneers share their inmost thoughts and convictions about Ellen White as God’s appointed messenger to the Seventh-day Adventist church.We share in their personall experiences and effects that her inspired counsel had upon their lives and the life of the church.

all.title: Why I Believe in Mrs. E. G. White
all.author: Francis D. Nichol
all.description: Some Reasons Why Seventh-day Adventists Believe That Ellen G. White Possessed the Gift of “the Spirit of Prophecy”

all.title: Understanding Ellen White
all.author: Dr. Merlin Burt
all.description: Basic to any understanding of Ellen White is her own walk with God. Everything she did must be understood and interpreted within this context. To open a window of understanding to Ellen White’s heart, readers need to know and even experience her passions. There are two braided golden threads that weave through her entire life and experience that are central to who she was and what she accomplished—the love of God in Christ and a focus on Scripture. Her orientation toward the love of God and the Bible were integrally interwoven with her prophetic ministry. Her writings, which were guided by prophetic revelation through visions and prophetic dreams, must be read and understood with this perspective.

all.title: 101 Questions - About Ellen White and Her Writings
all.author: William A. Fagal
all.description: If you could ask one question of Ellen White, what would it be? Elder William Fagal, associate director of the Ellen G. White Estate, provides thought-provoking answers to 101 of the most frequently asked and often most controversial inquiries. He exposes many of the myths that have developed and introduces readers to the real truth about this inspirational author.

all.title: Basic Rules of Interpretation-Internal and External

all.description: For verbal inspirationists Ellen White’s writings, unfortunately, have wrongly become an authority on historical dates and places. For thought inspirationists however, it's an unwarranted use of a prophet’s work. Thought inspirationists focus on the big picture, the message; while possible discrepancies in historical detail are considered incidental to the message, and of minor clerical importance.

all.description: Will God ever send another prophet to the Seventh-day Adventist church? This question was increasingly being raised as Ellen White’s life drew to a close, and some people still wonder. Dr. Coon responds to this question from the Bible, not by telling us whether God will ever send another prophet—but explaining how to recognize a true prophet and how to identify a fraud. He also tells the story of three people in the history of the church who claimed the prophetic gift but whose ministry did not match the guidelines set forth in Scripture.

all.title: American King James Version
all.author: Public Domain
all.description: This is a new edition of the Holy Bible, based on the original King James Version. It is a simple word for word update from the King James English. Care has been taken to not make any doctrinal changes, but to simply update the spelling and vocabulary. No grammatical changes have been made in order to retain meaning.

all.title: American Standard Version
all.author: Philip Schaff, editor
all.description: The American Standard Version of 1901 is based on the Revised Version Bible, a collaborated revision by dozens of British and America scholars in the 1880s. The text is an update of the KJV, with more modern spelling and greater accuracy of translation. It has been called “The rock of Biblical honesty, ” although it never surpassed the KJV in popularity of use. A notable change from the KJV is reference to God as “Jehovah ” instead of the traditional “Lord.”

all.title: Darby Bible
all.author: James N. Darby
all.description: This Bible was first published in 1890. The New Testament translation was published in 1867 by John Nelson Darby, an Anglo-Irish Bible teacher associated with the early years of the Plymouth Brethren. The later Old Testament publication was based on his translations into French and German, and was completed in English by his students, after his death. The Darby Bible’s official title reads, “A new translation from the original languages,” and its text reflects that with modernized language and spelling. Darby also published translations of the Bible in French and German.

all.title: International Children's Bible
all.author: Ellen G. White
all.description: Licensed from Harper Collins Publishers

all.title: King James Version
all.author: King James Ist
all.description: The third official English translation of the Bible, the King James Version was first published in 1611 and has remained the standard for many theologians and Bible scholars to this day. It has also been the basis for many other English Bibles, forming the foundation of their text. Commissioned under King James of England, the seven-year-long translation was performed from Hebrew (Old Testament) and Greek (New Testament) by 47 scholars, based at Westminster, and the Universities at Cambridge and Oxford.

all.title: King James Reference Version
all.author: James Strong
all.description: Authorized King James Version with Strong's Markup

all.title: King James Bible With Strong's Dictionary

all.title: New Century Version

all.title: New English Translation

all.title: New King James Version
all.author: Ellen G. White
all.description: Licensed from Harper Collins Publishers

all.title: Webster’s Bible
all.author: Noah Webster
all.description: This lightly-revised version update of the King James Version was originally published in 1833 by Noah Webster. While Webster wanted to update certain aspects of the language, his aim was not to make it entirely modern. Therefore, his translation is very similar—almost identical—to that of the original King James Version.

all.title: World English Bible
all.author: Public Domain
all.description: The World English Bible (WEB) is a modern English translation of the Bible which is available in the Public Domain. Though still in draft form, the text is free for copying and use by the public. Based on the American Standard Version (ASV), this translation uses modern language and spelling. Some notable changes from the KJV are reference to God as “Yahweh” and lowercase “he,” instead of the traditional “Lord” and “He.”

all.title: Young’s Literal Translation
all.author: Robert Young
all.description: Young's Literal Translation of the Bible is fundamentally different from other, more common translations in that the YLT aims for strict adherence to the literal meaning of the original Hebrew or Greek text. Therefore, for example, many passages are written in present tense where traditional versions would be past tense. Originally published in 1862, the most recent revision was made in 1898, after Young's death.

all.title: El Conflicto Inminente
all.author: Ellen Gould White
all.description: La publicación, tomada de los capítulos seleccionados en el conflicto de los siglos no sólo describe las batallas presentes y futuras entre Dios y Satanás, sino que también muestra claramente la esperanza de gloria que espera a los fieles. El autor poderosamente señala los principios involucrados en el conflicto inminente y cómo cada persona puede apoyar firmemente a Dios y su verdad.

all.title: La Iglesia Remanente
all.author: Ellen Gould White
all.description:
“La luz brilla en la oscuridad.” Este atributo especial de la obra de Cristo ha sido la característica que define su iglesia a través de los siglos. Y también el pueblo de Dios, pero no del mundo, se describen como su remanente y sus tesoros con una luz especial en el mundo oscuro.
Teniendo esto en cuenta, la iglesia remanente reúne a algunos de los escritos de Elena White más aplicables sobre el tema, a fin de dar una imagen vívida de la iglesia de Dios, su organización y su trabajo en el mundo de hoy.

all.title: Testimonios Selectos Tomo 1
all.author: Ellen Gould White
all.description: La serie de Testimonios seleccionados recoge textos de muchos de los trabajos previamente publicados por Elena White. El primer volumen habla de las primeras experiencias de la hermana White y los trabajos de los pioneros de Adviento. Este texto es comparable con el libro de Inglés Experiencia cristiana y enseñanzas.

all.title: Testimonios Selectos Tomo 2
all.author: Ellen Gould White
all.description: La serie de Testimonios seleccionados recoge textos de muchos de los trabajos previamente publicados en Elena White. Los detalles segundo volumen de la historia del plan de redención - a partir de la caída de Lucifer, y terminando en el gran final definitiva de la controversia. El texto es similar a la encontrada en los libros en inglés Dones espirituales, el Espíritu de la Profecía, e Historia de la Redención.

all.author: Ellen Gould White
all.publisher: Bale Société Internationale De Traités/Bale Company International Trea

all.title: Erweckung — Was dann?
all.author: Ellen Gould White
all.description: Was bedeutet eine wahre Bekehrung? Und wir kann ich in der Gnade “zum vollen Maß der Fülle Christi” wachsen? Ein neues Leben das sich auf Erweckung und Reformation konzentriert beantwortet Fragen über dieses Thema. Der Text ist aus verschiedenen Artikeln entnommen und als kleines Handbuch zusammengestellt.

all.title: Gemeinschaft mit Gott
all.author: Ellen Gould White
all.description: “Das Gebet ist das Atmen der Seele. Es ist das Geheimnis der Kraft des Innenlebens.” Die Atmosphäre des Gebetes und der Hingabe während des Tages ist ein wichtiger Teil des geistlichen Lebens - besonders in den letzten Momenten der Geschichte der Erde. Diese Publikation bietet eine praktische Zusammenstellung von hilfreichen Aussagen um unser Gebetsleben und unsere Gemeinschaft mit unserem Herrn zu bereichern und zu vertiefen.

all.title: Hier in Europa muss ein großes Werk getan werden
all.author: Ellen Gould White
all.description: Diese Ausgabe besteht aus einem Brief der von Ellen White bezüglich dem Werk und seiner Wichtigkeit in Europa geschrieben wurde. Diese Botschaft ist für uns heute  genauso gültig wie zu ihrer Zeit.

all.title: Die Leiden Christi
all.author: Ellen Gould White
all.description:
“Die Leiden Christi”
Das Ziel dieser kleinen Publikation ist für seine Leser ebenso wie für Paulus vor ihnen - nichts zu wissen als “Jesus Christus und den Gekreuzigten”. Während der Geschichte der Erde - beides vor und nach seiner Geburt in Betlehem und Tod auf Golgatha - wurde Christi Werk von Generation zu Generation erzählt. Und Sein Dienst und großes Opfer wird unsere Wissenschaft und Gesang für alle Ewigkeit sein. Zu diesem Zweck wurden die Leiden Christi mit dem besonderen Fokus auf die Einzelheiten der letzten Stunden des Lebens unseres Heilandes veröffentlicht.

all.title: Die Vollendung unserer Aufgabe
all.author: Ellen Gould White
all.description: Diese kurze Veröffentlichung konzentriert sich auf den großen Auftrag, den Christus seinen Jüngern gegeben hat: hinzugehen und alle Nationen zu lehren. Was ist unser Werk als seine Kinder? Und wie können wir wirksam das Evangelium der Welt bringen?

all.title: Wir haben einen Fürsprecher
all.author: Ellen Gould White
all.description: Das Werk Christi im himmlischen Heiligtum ist eine Schlüsselwahrheit unserer Zeit—die besonders seit der großen Enttäuschung 1844 ins Blickfeld gerückt wurde. Dieses kleine Buch beschreibt im einzelnen die Wichtigkeit der Prophetie, die gegenwärtige Tätigkeit und die praktische Anwendung des Heiligtumsdienstes.

all.title: La chiesa del rimanente
all.author: Ellen Gould White
all.description:
“ La luce splende nelle tenebre.” Questo speciale attributo dell'opera di Cristo è stato attraverso i secoli, la caratteristica distintiva della sua Chiesa. E il popolo di Dio, stando nel mondo ma non essendo del mondo, viene descritto come il suo rimanente ed il suo tesoro particolare, una luce nel mondo oscuro.
In questa prospettiva, La Chiesa del rimanente riunisce alcuni degli scritti di Ellen White più appropriati sul tema, al fine di dare un quadro vivido della chiesa di Dio, della sua organizzazione, e della sua opera nel mondo di oggi.

all.title: Nostro Padre Celeste Si Prende Cura Di Noi
all.author: Ellen Gould White

all.title: Atos Dos Apóstolos
all.author: Ellen Gould White
all.description: A fascinante história dos primeiros cristãos é apresentada no volume 4 da série “O Conflito dos Séculos”, intitulado “Atos dos Apóstolos”. Após ser vencido por Cristo na cruz, Satanás, com grande ira, voltou sua atenção à igreja de Cristo na terra. Nesse livro você encontrará muitas emocionantes histórias de cruéis perseguições e da inabalável lealdade dos fiéis de Deus. Pedro, Paulo, Tiago, João, Lucas, Barnabé, Estevão, Marcos, e os outros apóstolos proclamaram as preciosas novas do Evangelho a todo o mundo então conhecido. Resolutos em não renunciar sua fé, muitos perderam sua vida. Mas a história ainda continua. A igreja de Cristo hoje está promovendo a mesma obra daquela época e ela têm a mesma promessa de direção e poder divinos de então.

all.title: A Ciência Do Bom Viver, A
all.author: Ellen Gould White

all.title: Conselhos Aos Pais, Professores E Estudantes
all.author: Ellen Gould White
all.description: Conselhos sobre como conduzir uma escola, com atenção especial às matérias, à disciplina e aos objetivos a serem enfatizados.

all.title: Fundamentos do Lar Cristão
all.author: Ellen Gould White
all.description: Nessa publicação, textos selecionados do livro “O Lar Adventista” foram reunidos para formar um livro menor. Mesmo assim, ele contém a mesma orientação prática para as famílias cristãs. Os tópicos incluem: em que localidade estabelecer o lar, como torná-lo agradável, além de apresentar conselhos sobre como conviver bem com os membros da família.

all.title: A Igreja Remanescente
all.author: Ellen Gould White
all.description: “A luz brilha nas trevas.” Esse atributo tão especial da obra de Cristo tem sido uma característica essencial de Sua igreja ao longo dos séculos. O povo de Deus, no mundo mas do mundo, é descrito como Seus remidos e Seu tesouro especial — uma luz a brilhar num mundo escuro.</br> Com isso em vista, o livro “A Igreja Remanescente” apresenta alguns dos textos mais relevantes escritos por Ellen White sobre esse tema, visando proporcionar uma vívida perspectiva sobre o que é a igreja de Deus, como deve ser sua organização e que obra deve desempenhar no mundo atual.

all.title: A Igreja Remanescente
all.author: Ellen Gould White
all.description:
“A luz brilha nas trevas.” Esse atributo tão especial da obra de Cristo tem sido uma característica essencial de Sua igreja ao longo dos séculos. O povo de Deus, no mundo mas do mundo, é descrito como Seus remidos e Seu tesouro especial — uma luz a brilhar num mundo escuro.
Com isso em vista, o livro “A Igreja Remanescente” apresenta alguns dos textos mais relevantes escritos por Ellen White sobre esse tema, visando proporcionar uma vívida perspectiva sobre o que é a igreja de Deus, como deve ser sua organização e que obra deve desempenhar no mundo atual.

all.title: Reavivamento Verdadeiro
all.author: Ellen Gould White
all.description: O que significa a verdadeira conversão? Como posso continuar a crescer em graça “até a medida da estatura da plenitude de Cristo”? Esse livro focaliza no processo de reavivamento e reforma, e responde a diversas perguntas sobre o tema. O texto foi extraído de vários artigos e compilado em um pequeno manual.

all.title: Обетования для последних дней
all.author: Ellen Gould White
all.description: “Изгладить из Слова Божьего Его обетования означает то же самое, что погасить на небе солнце. Ничто другое, кроме обетований, не может так поддерживать нас. На нашем пути Бог насаждает цветы обетований, чтобы украсить ими нашу жизнь. Он устроил дорогу к небесам такой приятной. Когда мы изучаем Божьи обетования, то находим в них утешение, надежду и радость, потому что они являются Словами Безграничного”.</br>В этой книге собраны слова обетования и утешения для людей любого возраста и жизненной ситуации. Данные обетования, поддерживающие жизнь, особенно важны в эти последние дни земной истории, когда с большей силой разгорается великая борьба. Когда уже не на что опереться, мы все еще можем ухватиться за шнурки веры и найти убежище в заверении Божьего неизменного слова.

all.title: Святая жизнь
all.author: Ellen Gould White
all.description: “Мы свидетельствуем о Боге не только проповедью истины и распространением литературы. Будем помнить, что христоподобная жизнь служит самым убедительным свидетельством в пользу христианства, а профанация христианами своего призвания делает больше вреда, чем жизнь мирских людей. Не все книги могут послужить той же цели, которую в силах достичь благочестивая жизнь христиан. Люди поверят не тому, что проповедуется служителями церкви, а тому, какую жизнь ведут ее члены”.</br>Эта книга в основном является выдержкой из 9-го тома “Свидетельств для церкви”, и очень практически показывает нам, что такое христоподобная жизнь.
